name: Good Eats Bistro
address: 100-15 Ditmars Blvd, East Elmhurst, NY 11369, USA

reviews.text: The host at breakfast was super hardworking and efficient, he really impressed us. The food was yummy and the portions large. Good coffee ! Thanks so much.
Jesus was very attentive and friendly! Food was great too!
I got the blackened chicken and it was absolutely amazing, the best chicken sandwich ever. The server Josh gave an incredible experience and top shelf service. Would come back here again üëå10/10
The food is very good going again very soon
The chief Kevin made some good seafood pasta. The waiter was very polite. I recommend you to come here if u want some good food.
Couldn't find it ... just saw a food truck

The food was excellent and the service was fun. We had the seafood pasta and a burger and both were fantastic. Highly recommended! In fact, it was so good I went back the next day and Kevin, the day chef, took great care of us. He was friendly and helpful. You‚Äôll have a great meal here.
Amazing food. Will come again.
Not bad.  Better than free breakfasts at other cheap hotels around the area‚Ä¶
Fabulous staff and good food. The service was very efficient and friendly. I very much appreciate the kindness of all the staff throughout my long lunch here.
Great food for the price. But you're still in an Aloft lobby

Eat here the restaurant is inside the hotel the best spot to eat in the whole area you have to walk into the hotel like if your checking in then you make a right from the front desk and the restaurant is in the lobby
amazing service and delishus food. server josh was very amiable. regards to cook nicolas
If you want a good portion of meal, it‚Äôs worth your money. Clean place and friendly staffs.
We really enjoyed the food and service here. It was empty when we were here for supper. Shana was super and answered all our questions. Even those not limited to the menu. Awesome! üòé
I had a seafood pasta that was outstanding the mischief's hospitality was excellent
I tried to order lunch, nobody was around to help. Came back for dinner, they overcooked my chicken wings. Un edible, you can order Uber eats and get a better meal.

Just don‚Äôt even come

$26 for a bad burger and fries

Food is overpriced and terrible. We had a Caesar salad with overcooked, old chicken and no croutons, buffalo cauliflower which was boiled too long (soggy) and tossed in sauce, twice baked potatoe and 2 glasses of Pinot‚Ä¶ $76! Service was better which is why I gave it 2 stars.
They do not take responsibility for their mistakes. Bad service. Will not order here again

Was there yesterday for lunch.  I was in the mood for tasty sandwich and Mark made me the BEST chicken cutlet w fresh mozzarella and bacon.  Always great meal when I'm in the area, I will definitely be back real soon!!
Very nice place and hella good recipe
Super expensive and the food is not that good. 18 for a burger that doesn‚Äôt come with fries so you have to add fries for 8 dollars. Terrible

Very good food. We had Cobb salad and Caesar for dinner, both were delicious. I really liked how they made the chicken crispy, you could taste the freshness of the ingredients. The breakfast was very good too and reasonable prices. Friendly staff!
Great food and service, these guys truly understand the concept of hospitality.
Friendly service, The food speaks for itself, Top quality food, Highly recommended,  Mike the waiter was very kind.

Service was great, but they completely butchered my Cobb Salad.  Unfortunately I took it to go, and didn't discover until too late. It's not really a Cobb when you're missing pretty much all of the key ingredients (avocado, bacon, Bleu cheese).
Excellent food and service! The seafood pasta was delicious and the pot roast sandwich was amazingly tender!
Delicious food, great service and awesome price.

This restaurant is hit or miss when it comes to food. So far I've had the cheeseburger which was really good and came with a side of fries the pizza did not disappoint either. Breakfast is lacking, the ham and cheese omelette was not good,‚Ä¶
